intro: Phyllanthus goniostemon, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants.
